<<<explanation>>>: The error you are experiencing is likely due to the fact that you are trying to access the TextView before the layout has been inflated and set as the content view of the activity. In Android, the setContentView method is used to set the layout file for an activity. This method should be called before accessing any views in the layout file. To fix the issue, you should call setContentView in the onCreate method of your activity, before trying to access the TextView. Here's an example of how to use setContentView:

@Override
protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
    super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
    setContentView(R.layout.activity_main);

    // Now you can access the TextView
    TextView tv_scoreDisplay = (TextView) findViewById(R.id.tv_scoreDisplay);
    // Rest of your code...
}
